article:
In cardiology 'neocardiogenesis' is the homeostatic regeneration, repair and
renewal of sections of malfunctioning adult cardiovascular tissue. This includes
a combination of cardiomyogenesis (the regeneration of cardiac muscle) and
angiogenesis (the regeneration of blood vessels). Zimmet, H. and Krum, H.
2008. âUsing Adult Stem Cells to Treat Heart Failure- Fact or Fiction?â Heart,
Lung and Circulation 17S:S48-S54.
